Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Sherd
Description: Sherd of a hemispherical bowl with a restricted mouth. The clay is fine, red with a black rim, and has been polished inside and burnished outside. The decorations are not very carefully executed: concentric diamonds incised under the lip and cross-hatching incised on the body. This vessel is of the same type as L 1537 (a), but not as carefully executed.
